resources.string: Hello, the evaluation period is over. Please contact Avintangu at support@avintangu.com to get a perpetual licence
Bizsmat application is purposed to enable business people to:
a) Create an electronic price-list that groups products in categories
b) Track sales with the sales value and profit
c) Keep track of the stocks levels
d) Manage the customer debts and payments
c) It has an analytics module that presents data in a more comprehensible format in tables and charts
d) The user data is backed up online and can be accessed from any other device
- You need to create product categories, create products and create stocks for the new products. You can now create sales and debts records. This is explained in details on the user manual topics
Back icon – Takes you back to the previous view
Save button – It saves the report based on the context
Menu icon – Displays the left drawer menu
New button – Enables you to create records based on the context
Add icon – Adds items based on the context
Date icon – Enables you to select the date from a pop-up calendar
b) Enter the default password (New user)
d) Click the assign user button to assign the app to your account
e) The app will be assigned to your account and it will open
Click the products icon on the home screen to open the products module
Back icon - takes you back to the home screen
New icon - This icon is context based, you can create new products on the products view and new product categories on the products categories view
- Before creating the products, you have to first create the product categories
Click the categories tab in order to switch to the products categories
Click the new button to create a new product category
Enter the product category name and click the save button to save the new product category
After saving report you will be taken back to the products categories view
> click on the product category name, this will open the product category editing view. Edit as desired and click the save button on the top right corner to update the changes

> You can also delete the report from this view by clicking the delete button which will open the deleting prompt where you can proceed to delete the report or cancel the action. You will be taken back to the product categories view after selecting either of the two actions
> Open the product module and the products view is displayed by default
> Click the list tab to switch to products then click the new button to create a new product
> Select date and category, enter the product name and selling price
> Click the save button on the top right corner, the product will be saved and the you will be directed to the products view
> You can edit any product by clicking on the product name, edit as desired on the product edit view and click the save button on the top right corner to update the changes

> You can also delete the product from this view by clicking the delete button which will open the deleting prompt where you can proceed to delete the report or cancel the action. You will be taken back to the products view after selecting either of the two actions
- This module enables you to view the overall sales and stocks balances by products. Click the stocks icon on the home screen to open the stocks module
- The back button takes you to the home screen
> Click the entry tab to open the stocks entry view
> The stocks are grouped by dates. The floating menu icon enables you to select stock range view between two dates or create a new stock. You can also switch to the stocks balances view
> Click the new button to enter new stock

Select product, enter the buying price and quantity. You can add more products by clicking on the add button. There is no limit to the number of products that can be added. Click the save button on the top right corner to save the new stocks entry.
-> Click any product name to edit the stock entry
-> Edit as desired and click the save button on the top right corner to update report

-> You can delete the stocks record by clicking the delete button which will open the deleting prompt where you can proceed to delete the report or cancel the action. You will be taken back to the stocks view after selecting either of the two actions

- Click the sales icon on the home screen to open the sales module. This module enables you to view all the individual sales entries between two dates and grouped by the dates. It has the analytics module that curates the data in tables and graphs.
- The back button takes you back to the home screen
- The date icon enables you to change the dates margins
> Click the new button to create a new sale entry
> Select product and the price will be automatically be populated. Enter the quantity
> You can add more products by clicking the add icon
> You can add any number of products, the total cost will automatically update as the the products are being added
> You can also view the change by entering the amount submitted by the customer
> Click the save icon on the top left corner to save all the products created and you will be directed to the sales view. You can cancel the order by clicking the back button
> Click any product name to edit it > edit as desired and click the save button on the top right corner to update the sales record

> You can delete the sales record by clicking the delete button which will open the deleting prompt where you can proceed to delete the report or cancel the action. You will be taken back to the sales view after selecting either of the two actions
> After saving, editing or deleting a sales record, you will be directed to the sales view
> While on the sales view, click the back button to go back to the home screen
- This module curates the data and presents it in a desirable format in tables or charts. This module can be customized based on the client\'s needs
> Open the sales module by clicking the sales icon on the home screen. This will open the sales module then click the analytics tab which will open the sales analysis by product.
> You can go back by clicking the back button. This view is displayed based on two dates displayed on the left side of the floating menu icon
> To adjust the dates range, clicked on the date icon and select either of the calendar icons to change the dates.
> Click the menu icon and you can select any tables or charts on the left pop-up menu

- Click the debts icon on the home screen. This module enables you to track the customer debts and payments. Yo need to first create the customer, lend products to the customer then update the payments when the customer pays the debt
- This summary view shows the customer name, phone number and the customer\'s total debt
-The back button takes the user back to the home screen
> Open the debts module, click the new button to create a new customer
> Select date, enter the customer name and phone number then click the save button on the top right corner and the report will be saved and you will be directed to the summary view
> You can also cancel this by clicking the back button
> Open the debts module, click the customer\'s name that you want to lend products to. This will open the customer’s debts history
> Click the lend tab to lend products to the selected customer
> Select the product and the price will be automatically be updated
> Enter quantity, you can add more products by clicking the add button and enter the quantity
> The total value will be automatically updated as the products are added. Click the save button on the top right corner to lend to the customer
> After saving you will be directed to the customer debt history
> Open the debts module > open the customer debt history by clicking on any customer name then click the edit customer tab.
> Set date, edit the name and phone number as desired then click the save button on the top right corner to update the record then you will be directed to the customer\'s debt history window

> You can also delete a customer by clicking the delete button which will open the deleting prompt where you can proceed to delete the report or cancel the action. You will be taken back to the summary view after selecting either of the two actions
> Open debts module, click the payments tab
> Set date , select the customer\'s name and enter amount paid then click the save button on the top right corner to save the payment then you will be directed to the summary view
> Open debts module > click the payments tab
> Select any customer’s name to edit the payment
> Set date, edit customer and amount paid then click the save button on the top right corner to update the payment
>You can delete the record by clicking the delete button or cancel the edit by clicking the back button
> You can view the payments between any desired range of dates by clicking on the date icon, select the from or to calendar icon the select the date. You can also switch back to the summary view.
- This module enables you to create an orders and post directly to the distributor. You can compare the product prices from different distributors and order from a distributor of choice
> Click the orders icon on the home-screen to open the orders module
> The reload button enables you to refresh the distributors and price-lists
> You can change the distributor to compare the prices by clicking on the distributors drop-down and selecting any distributor to view
> Open the orders module and click on the orders tab. This opens a summary of the orders that you have placed with their delivery status
> This list shows the current month\'s orders, you can change the date margins by clicking the date icon and selecting the desired dates
> Click the new button to open a new order window
> Select the date (by default the current date and time are displayed)
> Select the outlet that you want to place the order
> Select the distributor that you want to order from
> Select the products that you want to order and enter the quantities
> Click the post button the the order will be sent to the selected distributor (This requires an active internet connection)
> Click on any cell on the date column of the orders list to open the order
> Edit the order as desired and click post to re-send the order. The distributor will get the modified version of the order
- This modules will enable you to sync data, update app, refresh data, recover deleted records or view the user manual
> Click the admin icon on the home screen to open the admin module. This view displays the user name, phone number and the app version
> To sync data - Click the sync button
> To update app - Click the update app button
> To refresh user data - click the refresh user data button
> Open the admin module > click the menu icon and select the recycle bin option on the left pop-up menu

> This displays all the reports that have been deleted. Click the item on the first column on any of the reports and you will get a recovery prompt which will ask you to confirm the recovery action. Click yes to recover or click cancel to go back
> Open the admin module > Click the menu icon and select any topic under the user manual title to view
